name: Sanatan Dinda
content:
Sanatan Dinda (Bengali: সনাতন দিন্দা) (born 5 February 1971) is an Indian visual artist from Kolkata India. He grew in stature to be the first Indian artist having a displayed portrait of Mother Teresa at the Buckingham Palace (a commissioned work).
 Dinda born in Kumartuli intestines of North Kolkata, he graduated fine arts (Western painting) from the Government College of Art & Craft, Kolkata in 1992.[1][2]
 Sanatan Dinda contributes to the Durga puja of his locality and in doing so has picked up various awards.[3] His artwork is private collections of  former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar [4] Amjad Ali Khan, RPG Enterprises, Reliance Industries, Ballarpur Industries Limited, etc. His exhibition at the Hyatt Regency hotel in Kolkata on 28–29 January 2010 was inaugurated by Amjad Ali Khan.

raw:
Indian visual artist from Kolkata India


Sanatan Dinda  সনাতন দিন্দাBorn (1971-02-05) 5 February 1971 (age 50)Kumartuli, North Kolkata,  KolkataNationalityIndianEducationGovernment College of Art & Craft, KolkataKnown forPainting, Drawing, Sculpture, Body painting,Websitesanatandinda.in
Sanatan Dinda (Bengali: সনাতন দিন্দা) (born 5 February 1971) is an Indian visual artist from Kolkata India. He grew in stature to be the first Indian artist having a displayed portrait of Mother Teresa at the Buckingham Palace (a commissioned work).

Early life and education[edit]
Dinda born in Kumartuli intestines of North Kolkata, he graduated fine arts (Western painting) from the Government College of Art & Craft, Kolkata in 1992.[1][2]

 Durga created by Sanatan Dinda in Kolkata, 2015.
Sanatan Dinda contributes to the Durga puja of his locality and in doing so has picked up various awards.[3] His artwork is private collections of  former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar [4] Amjad Ali Khan, RPG Enterprises, Reliance Industries, Ballarpur Industries Limited, etc. His exhibition at the Hyatt Regency hotel in Kolkata on 28–29 January 2010 was inaugurated by Amjad Ali Khan.
